items.title: Bitcoin’s Fragile Rebound Follows $20 Billion Leverage Wipeout
items.summary: Bitcoin’s modest recovery after Friday’s record crypto crash has done little to ease the fallout from over $20 billion purge of leveraged bets that left parts of the market incapacitated. The unprecedented washout erased months of speculative build-up and forced some funds out entirely, traders say.

items.title: Aurobindo Pharma promoters raise Rs 2k cr to fund realty, other asset buys
items.summary: The transaction is split into two parts. The Rs 650 crore Series 1 comes with a 24-month tenor and a two-year put and call option, and Rs 1,450 crore, which will be Series 2 with a four-year tenor. Series 1 will carry a coupon of 11.75%, while Series 2 is likely to be priced at 15.5%.

items.title: Exporters in Gift City can retain forex proceeds for 3 months now
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has amended FEMA regulations, allowing exporters to hold foreign exchange proceeds in Gujarat's Gift City for up to three months. This move provides operational relief and greater flexibility in repatriating funds, aligning with USD-INR trends. Previously, funds had to be repatriated by the end of the following month.

items.title: DPIP: RBI's AI tool to detect fraud in real time
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is launching a Digital Payments Intelligence Platform (DPIP) that will use AI to detect and prevent payment frauds in real time. Initially, a negative registry will flag suspicious entities, with the platform expanding to analyze transactions and assign risk scores for preventive measures.

items.title: Estimating India’s potential growth rate
items.summary: Positive and negative forces may balance themselves out, leaving a figure that is close to 6.5%

items.title: NDR InvIT expands North India footprint with ₹143.9-crore acquisition of Grade-A warehouse in Lucknow
items.summary: NDR InvIT Trust has acquired MLG Warehousing & Industrial Park in Lucknow for ₹143.9 crore. This strategic move strengthens NDR InvIT's logistics portfolio. The newly acquired facility is a Grade-A asset with significant leasable space. It is 98% leased to diverse tenants. This acquisition marks NDR InvIT's entry into Uttar Pradesh's growing logistics market.

items.title: JPMorgan to Plow $1.5 Trillion Into US Security Industries
items.summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. vowed to funnel $1.5 trillion into industries that bolster US economic security and resiliency over the next 10 years — an initiative that will invest billions of dollars in companies and hire bankers and other professionals.

items.title: Govt committee on nuclear power bats for up to 49% FDI
items.summary: A government committee has proposed allowing up to 49% foreign investment in India's nuclear power sector and amending the civil liability Act. These changes aim to shield operators from other liability laws and include equipment suppliers in contractual liability caps, facilitating global participation to meet the 100 GW nuclear capacity target by 2047.

items.title: OYO founder Ritesh Agarwal takes inspiration from Jeff Bezos, says success needs planning: ‘Hope is not a plan’
items.summary: Ritesh Agarwal, OYO's CEO, credits Jeff Bezos's mindset for his strategic approach to business, asserting that ambition must be grounded in planning and risk evaluation.

items.title: Direct tax collection Increases 6.3% to ₹11.9 lakh cr in FY26 so far
items.summary: India's net direct tax collections reached ₹11.89 lakh crore between April 1 and October 12, marking a 6.33% year-on-year increase. Despite a 15.98% drop in refunds issued, gross tax collections saw a 2.36% rise to ₹13.92 lakh crore. The government has set a net direct tax revenue target of ₹25.2 lakh crore for FY26.

items.title: Nokia lines up 'several deals' in India; Co set to launch millimetre-wave FWA products in India
items.summary: Nokia plans to launch millimetre-wave fixed wireless access products in India within six months, aiming to double its enterprise and hyperscaler business in three years. The company is finalizing partnerships in key sectors and sees significant growth potential in India's expanding enterprise networking and private 5G markets.

items.title: Pre-testing exercise held for new household income survey
items.summary: India's statistics ministry pre-tested its National Household Income Survey, a first-ever pan-India initiative to measure household income, set for launch in February 2026. The survey will capture diverse income sources and expenditures, crucial for economic indicators and poverty analysis. Recommendations include building public confidence and ensuring data collection sensitivity.

items.title: 'A third of textile export firms' turnover drops 50% on US tariff'
items.summary: Indian textile and apparel exporters are facing a significant downturn, with about a third reporting a nearly 50% drop in turnover due to increased US tariffs. Buyers are requesting discounts, cancelling orders, and reducing volumes, leading to inventory buildup and extended credit cycles for exporters.

items.title: Bira 91 auditor flags threat to asset fair value
items.summary: Bira 91, the maker of Bira beer, faces significant financial challenges. Its auditor's report for fiscal year 2024 reveals an eroded net worth and doubts about its ability to continue operations. The company has accumulated substantial losses and its liabilities exceed assets. This situation has led to employee concerns and calls for leadership change.

items.title: Centre eases norms for states to avail capex loans
items.summary: The Centre has relaxed loan conditions for states' capital expenditure. A larger portion of funds is now untied, offering states more project flexibility. States that have utilized initial loan installments can access remaining funds without further conditions by onboarding the single nodal agency system. This move aims to boost transparency and encourage reform adoption.

items.title: Ennore tragedy: BHEL asked to take strict disciplinary action
items.summary: The Centre has ordered BHEL to take action against officials involved in the Ennore Thermal Power Station steel arch collapse. Nine migrant workers died in the incident. The Ministry of Heavy Industries is seeking resignations from director-level officers. A probe is underway to fix accountability for the lapses. Subcontractor selection is also under scrutiny. Three contractors have been arrested.

items.title: ONGC eyes 15% cost reduction to address lower oil price regime
items.summary: ONGC expects oil prices to remain between $60-65/barrel for the next two-three years, barring “few ups and downs”.

items.title: Govt opens PM GatiShakti portal to private sector
items.summary: The Indian government has opened the PM GatiShakti portal to the private sector. This move aims to help businesses optimize last-mile delivery services and develop infrastructure-based applications. The platform provides access to geospatial data for planning and investment decisions. It covers various infrastructure assets, enabling better project design and coordination.

items.title: States, UTs to be ranked on labour welfare steps
items.summary: The Ministry of Labour and Employment will launch an annual index in 2026 to evaluate states and union territories on their implementation of labour welfare measures. This index will rank them based on inclusiveness, efficiency, and innovation, aiming to foster competitive federalism and attract investments.

items.title: India trade negotiators set to visit US this week, may agree to buy more natural gas from US to bridge trade gap
items.summary: Indian trade negotiators are heading to the US this week for talks on a bilateral trade agreement, with both sides hopeful of concluding the first phase by year-end. Discussions are progressing positively, and New Delhi may also increase natural gas purchases from the US to address the trade gap.

items.title: Smartphones may contribute over ₹3 lakh cr in taxes during PLI years
items.summary: India's smartphone industry projects over ₹65,000 crore in GST this fiscal, following ₹2.45 lakh crore during the PLI scheme's initial phase. The PLI scheme has significantly boosted production and exports, contributing substantially to government revenue and establishing India as a major global player in mobile manufacturing.

items.title: India's retail inflation falls to 8-year low in September
items.summary: India's retail inflation dropped to a near three-year low of 1.5% in September, primarily due to falling food prices. This easing inflation, below the RBI's target, has economists anticipating a potential rate cut in December, especially if growth momentum falters.

items.title: Silver beats gold, scorching Rs 11,000 run up in a day; gold at high of Rs 1.27 lakh
items.summary: White metal’s trajectory steeper than gold as it zooms 58% over a month, notches up unheard-of single-day rise: Silver prices have reached an unprecedented Rs 1.73 lakh per kg. This surge is driven by strong investor demand and a global shortage of the precious metal.  Tight global supplies and expectations of lower interest rates are key factors. Jewellers are facing challenges as consumers seek silver amid its rally.

items.title: Penny stock under Re 1 to be in focus in Tuesday; here's why
items.summary: Penny stock under Re 1: Spright Agro shares will be in focus of the stock market investors on Tuesday, 14 October 2025, after this supply agreement update. Shares have risen 470% since 2021.&nbsp;

items.title: WHO warns of contaminated India cough syrups linked to 17 child deaths
items.summary: The World Health Organization has issued a health advisory regarding three contaminated cough syrups from India. Specific batches of COLDRIF, Respifresh TR, and ReLife are identified. These products pose severe health risks. India's Central Drugs Standard Control Organization reported that 17 children under five died after consuming these syrups. Authorities confirm no contaminated medicines were exported from India.

items.title: Dutch government takes charge of Chinese-owned chipmaker Nexperia, parent firm's shares drop 10% in Shanghai
items.summary: The Dutch government has taken over control of a Chinese chipmaker, Nexperia. The chipmaker's parent company, Wingtech Technology, shares dropped 10% on the Shanghai exchange on Monday.&nbsp;

items.title: Govt's net direct tax receipt grows 6.3% so far this fiscal to  ₹11.89 trillion
items.summary: Prior to adjusting for tax refunds, direct tax revenue collection up to 12 October this financial year stood at  ₹13.92 trillion, showing an annual growth of 2.4%.

items.title: DPIIT launches PM GatiShakti Offshore for integrated planning
items.summary: The DPIIT launched PM GatiShakti-Offshore, a digital platform for integrated planning of offshore projects like wind farms and marine exploration. This initiative aims to strengthen India's Blue Economy and support sustainable coastal growth. Additionally, the Logistics Excellence, Advancement, and Performance Shield (LEAPS) 2025 was launched to benchmark logistics excellence and enhance India's competitiveness.

items.title: Taliban Minister calls for easing visa regime, enhanced trade
items.summary: Muttaqi meets business representatives calls for more business, visas

items.title: Jio Payments Bank wins contract for MLFF project at 2 toll plazas on Gurugram-Jaipur highway
items.summary: So far, five MLFF bids have been awarded, of which JPBL has secured two

items.title: India to display strength, modernisation of Railways at Asia's largest railway equipment exhibition
items.summary: Asia's largest railway exhibition, IREE 2025, will be held in New Delhi from October 15-17. The event will highlight advanced technologies like AI and IoT. It will also focus on sustainable railway solutions and youth involvement. Global collaboration and ease of business for participants are key themes.

items.title: BMS launches selective cardiac myosin inhibitor drug in India
items.summary: Mavacamten was approved by the CDSCO

items.title: Steel demand in India set to grow 9% in 2025, 2026
items.summary: India's steel demand is set for strong growth.  Consumption will rise by 9% in both 2025 and 2026. This surge is fueled by all sectors using steel.  Globally, demand is expected to be flat this year.  However, India's production is already growing.  This positive trend is driven by infrastructure and housing projects.

items.title: Startup Partnr, partner of mechanics plans to expand to 50 cities
items.summary: They will also be foraying into the 4-wheeler aftermarket to serve a wider base of automotive stakeholders

items.title: Insurance brokers body raise issue of GST burden transfer by general insurers
HCLTech posts a flat Q2 net profit; revenue up 11%
items.summary: Contrary to the current people trend in the tech industry, HCLTech reported a net addition of 3,489 employees taking the total workforce count to 2,26,640

items.title: Critical minerals supply secure, says Mining Secretary
items.summary: Secretary of Mines emphasises on collaboration. Says, building a resilient critical minerals ecosystem depends on rapidly developing domestic processing capacities and tight industry-academia collaboration

items.title: India sees early warning for disaster as global public good, inclusive, multilingual, anticipatory, says P K Mishra
items.summary: He urged the G20 to strengthen interoperable regional platforms, shared data protocols, and joint capacity-building initiatives under the global ‘Early Warnings for All framework’.

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Tuesday
items.summary: Indian markets closed lower on Monday, led by IT stocks, as renewed US-China trade tensions and a US government shutdown dampened investor sentiment. Analysts noted profit booking in consumption sectors and mixed Q2 earnings, though mid- and small-cap stocks showed resilience. The Nifty defended its support at 25,200, with a bullish outlook above 25,050.

items.title: Amit Shah inaugurates Rs 4 lakh crore projects in Rajasthan, unveils exhibition on new criminal laws
items.summary: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday inaugurated investment projects worth Rs 4 lakh crore in Jaipur and opened a state-level exhibition on India's new criminal laws. He said the reforms will modernise justice delivery while accelerating Rajasthan's growth.

items.title: Govt releases plan for evacuation of 65 GW hydro power from Brahmaputra basin
items.summary: The government has unveiled a Rs 6,42,944 crore plan to evacuate 65 GW of hydroelectric power from the Brahmaputra basin by 2035. This involves extensive transmission line and transformation capacity development. Further expansion beyond 2035 will require an additional Rs 4,51,935 crore for more transmission infrastructure.

items.title: ONGC eyes cost optimization as subdued oil prices, maturing fields threaten profits
items.summary: ONGC is scaling up its supply base at the Pipavav port which is being scaled-up with end-goal of accounting for around two-thirds of the company’s work load on the West coast

items.title: HCLTech reports fastest Q2 growth in five years, calls AI revenue in a first
items.summary: HCL Technologies Ltd reported a strong second-quarter performance with a 2.8% sequential revenue growth to $3.64 billion, surpassing estimates. The company also marked revenue from AI, contributing $100 million. HCLTech's net profit rose 8% to $486 million.

items.title: Tata MF suspends fresh investment in Silver ETF Fund of Fund amid high silver prices
Commodities hype alert: Silver is next gold, copper next silver... beware investors, warns Gurmeet Chadha
items.summary: Gold and silver are hitting record highs, but an expert warns investors against overexposure to commodities, citing their complex, long-term cycles. Despite global uncertainties and trade tensions fueling demand, a near-term correction is possible, though Bank of America has raised its 2026 price forecasts for both metals.

items.title: NITI Aayog releases report on deep-sea fisheries, asks govt to have dedicated scheme
items.summary: The report titled “India’s Blue Economy: Strategy for Harnessing Deep-Sea and Offshore Fisheries” has suggested steps in three phases over the next 15 years

items.title: India-Japan work pact to send 50,000 skilled professionals to Japan: Consul-General
items.summary: In his address, Muneo emphasised the need for collaboration between Indian and Japan not only in economy and the technological sector, but also in people-to-people exchange, education, and culture

items.title: ONGC plans oil trading biz with a target of $1 billion annual profit
items.summary: ONGC is set to launch an oil trading business next fiscal year in partnership with an international firm, aiming for $1 billion annual profit. This venture will consolidate crude oil purchases from its refiners and production from its overseas subsidiary. Separately, ONGC has engaged BP's experts to improve the underperforming KG-DWN-98/2 deepwater block.

items.title: EPFO eases withdrawal limits with new rules, allows 100% access under select conditions: All you need to know
items.summary: EPFO has eased and liberalised its withdrawal limit rules, allowing 100 per cent access under select conditions and expanding limits for education and marriage, while the minimum service period has been reduced to 12 months for all withdrawals.

items.title: Alliance Air debuts fixed fares, government says the move will encourage demand
items.summary: Fair Se Fursat is aimed at giving passengers freedom from the stress of fluctuating airfares and promoting ease of flying in the country

items.title: Net direct tax collection rises over 6% to ₹11.89 lakh crore in April-Oct
items.summary: Driven by higher non-corporate tax mop-up, drop in refunds

items.title: National Household Income Survey to seek info on income sources, govt schemes, others
items.summary: This will be the first-ever pan-India survey focused on measuring household income

items.title: PM Modi welcomes release of Israeli hostages, lauds Trump's peace efforts and Netanyahu's resolve
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has welcomed the release of Israeli hostages held by Hamas, praising US President Donald Trump’s role in securing peace and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s leadership.

items.title: EPFO eases norms, early withdrawal up to 100% allowed
items.summary: CBT decided to simplify the partial withdrawal provisions of EPF Scheme by merging 13 complex provisions into a single, streamlined rule categorised into three types

items.title: Market Trading Guide: Buy Eternal, CDSL and 3 other stocks on Tuesday for up to 10% gains
items.summary: Indian benchmark indices Nifty saw a sell-off in FMCG and IT stocks, ending a two-session gain amid weak global cues. Analysts suggest Nifty remains bullish above 25,050, with potential upside towards 25,400. Fresh call writing at 25,300 indicates a resistance level, while 25,200 acts as strong support.

items.title: Alliance Air to offer fixed airfares until Dec 31 under 'Fares se Fursat' scheme
items.summary: Alliance Air has launched 'Fares se Fursat,' a new airfare scheme offering a single, fixed fare regardless of booking date, even on departure day. This pilot initiative, running from October 13 to December 31, 2025, aims to eliminate passenger stress from fluctuating prices and democratize air travel, aligning with the UDAN scheme's principles.

items.title: Land acquired for Tata's Singur plant won't be restored to firms operating prior to acquisition: SC
items.summary: The Supreme Court ruled that land acquired for Tata Motors' Nano project in Singur will not be restored to industrial entities. The court clarified its 2016 verdict, stating the relief was for vulnerable farmers, not financially capable commercial enterprises.

items.title: EPFO extends deadline for filing new ECR to October 22 amid transition to upgraded system
items.summary: The Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has extended the last date for filing the revamped Electronic Challan-cum-Return (ECR) for September 2025 wages to October 22.

items.title: Religare may absorb arm Care Health via reverse merger
items.summary: Structuring avoids spotlight of a fresh IPO, but may test minority rights and valuation fairness

items.title: India's net direct tax collection rises 6.33% to over ₹11.89 lakh crore till October 12
items.summary: India's net direct tax revenue has risen by 6.33% to over ₹11.89 lakh crore by October 12th of the current fiscal year. This growth is attributed to robust corporate tax collections and a reduction in refund payouts. The government aims for a 12.7% increase in direct tax collection for the full fiscal year.

items.title: EPFO Board clears major reforms to simplify withdrawals, cut litigation, boost digital services
items.summary: The Central Board of Trustees of the Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation approved a series of key reforms, including simplified withdrawal rules, a new Vishwas Scheme to reduce litigation, and a digital overhaul under EPFO 3.0. The measures aim to improve convenience, compliance and transparency for more than 30 crore members.

items.title: Indian team to visit US this week for bilateral trade talks
items.summary: The first tranche of BTA will be finalised by fall, says official

items.title: Tata MF temporarily suspends subscription to units in Silver ETF Fund of Fund
items.summary: Tata MF said the premium in domestic silver prices directly impacts the valuation of the Tata Silver ETF FoF scheme

items.title: Tata Silver ETF FoF suspends subscription indefinitely; should investors worry?
items.summary: Tata Mutual Fund has suspended subscription to its Tata Silver ETF Fund of Funds citing market conditions and a shortage of the white metal in the domestic market.

items.title: Apparel maker Cantabil Retail eyes reveues of ₹1000 crore by FY27
items.summary: The company said that it is eyeing over 20 per cent growth in the ongoing festival season and is witnessing buoyant consumer sentiment over the past days and expects this momentum to continue till Diwali.

items.title: EPFO extends deadline for filing EPF return by a week till Oct 22
items.summary: EPFO has extended the deadline for filing EPF returns for September to October 22, 2025, to accommodate employers adapting to the new revamped ECR system. The labour ministry stated that awareness programs and interactive sessions are being conducted to ensure a smooth transition and timely, error-free filing.

items.title: Sebi asks companies to give reasons, valuations for related party transactions in revised disclosures guidelines
items.summary: Sebi has issued new guidelines for listed companies seeking approval for related party transactions (RPTs). Companies must now provide detailed justifications, valuation reports, and turnover percentages to audit committees and shareholders. However, smaller RPTs below 1% of turnover or Rs 10 crore are exempted from these stringent disclosure norms.

items.title: Govt readies first all-India income survey for 2026, seeks public inputs
items.summary: The National Household Income Survey (NHIS) will capture detailed information on household earnings, expenditure patterns, and sources of income across rural and urban India.

items.title: Air India senior VP & IOCC head Choorah Singh, named in DGCA notice, quits
items.summary: Choorah Singh, Air India's Senior Vice President and Head of IOCC, has resigned to pursue opportunities in Ireland. Vikram Dayal has been appointed as his successor. Singh's departure follows regulatory action against him and two other executives for alleged crew scheduling lapses earlier this year.

items.title: Bajaj Housing raises Rs 1000 crore in bonds, business grows 24% in Q2
items.summary: Bajaj Housing Finance has successfully raised Rs 1000 crore by selling bonds to investors. The company secured this funding at a coupon rate of 6.95%. These bonds are non-convertible debentures and will mature in January 2028. This issuance marks the lowest coupon rate for the company's bond sales since July.

items.title: From Industrial Revolution to China’s rise: 2025 Economics Nobel winner reveals secret to growth
items.summary: Joel Mokyr, the 2025 Nobel Laureate, argues that sustained economic growth—from the Industrial Revolution to China's industrial success—relies on a powerful synergy. How Mokyr's insights can be applied to our current economic landscape

items.title: RBI announces measures to facilitate cross-border trade transactions
items.summary: Indian banks and their overseas branches can now lend in Indian Rupees to residents of Bhutan, Nepal, and Sri Lanka, including their banks, to boost cross-border trade. This move, aimed at facilitating external trade and payments, follows recent RBI amendments to foreign exchange regulations.

items.title: India’s sugar output estimated at 30 million tonne, after diversion for ethanol
items.summary: Food Ministry adopts a cautious approach on permitting exports, awaiting Agriculture Ministry’s production estimates

items.title: SBI Securities Diwali Picks: 8 stocks that delivered up to 23.4% returns in Samvat 2081
items.summary: SBI Securities Diwali Picks 2024: Every year, SBI Securities shares its top picks for the Diwali special 'Muhurat' trading session. Last year, it recommended 12 stocks. How did these stocks perform? Did they reach their targets? Let's examine them one by one:

items.title: ET Market Watch: Markets slip as US-China trade tensions rattle Dalal Street
Emirates NBD gets ready with $ 1.7 billion cheque to buy majority control of RBL Bank
items.summary: Emirates NBD Bank is in advanced talks to invest Rs 15,000 crore in RBL Bank, aiming to become its largest shareholder with a 51% stake. The deal, pending RBI approval, will expand the UAE bank's Asian footprint and tap into the India-Middle East remittance market. RBL Bank's share price has surged in anticipation of this significant foreign investment.

items.title: Chandan Healthcare board approves ₹104 crore fund raise via preferential issue
items.summary: The Board of Directors of Chandan Healthcare has approved the issuance of up to 44.50 lakh fully convertible equity warrants on a preferential basis at ₹234 per warrant, aggregating to approximately ₹104 crore

items.title: Sa-Dhan reaches out to individual lenders to open liquidity tap for small- and mid-sized MFIs
items.summary: Govt working on guarantee mechanism to give lenders more assurance while lending to MFIs

items.title: What's causing the silver shortage in India this festive season?
items.summary: India faces a severe silver shortage, with prices soaring 10% above global rates due to surging investor demand and strong festive season purchases.  Physically backed ETFs have suspended new subscriptions to protect investors from inflated costs, while jewellers struggle to meet demand. Limited global supply and strong industrial needs exacerbate the situation.

items.title: FMCG companies see mid single digit revenue growth in Q2 FY26
items.summary: FMCG goods makers have stated that while the benefits of the revised GST have been passed on to the consumers, the transition will impact profitability during the quarter

items.title: Municipal waste to be used to build roads by 2027: Gadkari
items.summary: The Minister also announced a slew of projects, including three NHs, in Puducherry

items.title: India-Canada reboot: Both nations vow to rebuild trust to de-risk global economy together
WeWork Management bulk deal: CLSA sells 8.4 lakh shares in recently listed stock for Rs 52 crore
items.summary: Global markets company CLSA sold over 8 lakh shares in WeWork India Management on Monday. The deal size reached Rs 52 crore. WeWork India shares continued their decline for a second day. The stock is trading below its IPO price. The company's recent IPO saw lukewarm response from retail investors. Qualified Institutional Buyers drove the subscription.

items.title: GalaxEye to launch Mission Drishti in Q1 2026, eyes global markets for Earth observation data
items.summary: GalaxEye to launch India’s largest private satellite, Mission Drishti, in 2026, offering advanced sensor technology for various applications.

items.title: Canara Robeco AMC IPO subscribed 9.74 times, sees strong QIB demand
items.summary: The IPO received bids for 33.99 crore shares against 3.48 crore shares on offer, as per exchange data

items.title: Karwa Chauth week saw 40% jump in D2C sales: GoKwik report
items.summary: Karwa Chauth, once a regional North Indian ritual, is now a nationwide phenomenon. Cities like Bengaluru and Chennai are seeing a significant surge in D2C sales. This cultural shift has boosted eCommerce, with Karnataka and Tamil Nadu emerging as key markets. Bollywood and social media have played a crucial role in this expansion.

items.title: Sam Altman-backed edtech startup Campus acquires former Meta VP's Sizzle AI platform — Here's what we know
items.summary: Sam Altman-backed edtech startup ‘Campus’ acquired former Meta VP's Sizzle AI platform in efforts to boost the company's engineering roadmap. Here's what the company plans to do after the acquisition move…

items.title: Motilal Oswal expects Swiggy share price to rise 26% as business tailwinds strengthen
items.summary: Swiggy is poised for growth and margin expansion, supported by a recovering food delivery business and festive season tailwinds, according to Motilal Oswal. The company’s innovative offerings and optimized infrastructure position it well for profitability in the upcoming quarters.

items.title: EPFO liberalises partial withdrawal norms; move to benefit 70 million PF subscribers
items.summary: At the 238th meeting of the Central Board of Trustees (CBT) of EPFO, chaired by the labour and employment minister Mansukh Mandaviya, on Monday, the board also gave its go ahead to the ‘Vishwas Scheme’ to reduce litigation through rationalised penal damages, a comprehensive member-centric digital transformation framework, EPFO 3.0, to modernize provident fund services, EPFO’s tie-up with the India Post Payments Bank (IPPB) to provide doorstep Digital Life Certificate (DLC) services and appointment of four fund managers to manage the debt portfolio of EPFO.

items.title: From lending to treasury, lenders go big on AI for core operations
items.summary: SBI significantly using AI in developing its Yono 2.0 mobile app version

items.title: Wall Street today: US stocks rally after Trump softens tone against China, Broadcom soars 10%  on OpenAI deal
items.summary: At 12:06 PM ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average advanced 1.25%, the S&amp;P 500 gained 1.52%, the Nasdaq Composite climbed 2.03%

items.title: India panel urges faster nuclear approvals, fuel security to meet 100 GW goal
items.summary: A government panel has urged India to accelerate nuclear project timelines, secure long-term uranium supplies, and expand reprocessing capacity to meet its ambitious 100 GW nuclear target by 2047. Recommendations include faster approvals, domestic and foreign uranium sourcing, and utilizing advanced foreign reactor designs alongside indigenous ones.

items.title: Bayer’s gene and cell therapy pipeline aims to transform Parkinson’s, oncology, rare diseases and more
items.summary: Bayer, through its subsidiary Viralgen, is advancing cell and gene therapies (CGT) to cure diseases like Parkinson's, oncology, cardiovascular, and rare conditions.  With a growing pipeline and the largest gene therapy manufacturer in Europe, Bayer aims to bring impactful treatments to patients worldwide, building on successful early interventions.

items.title: HCL Tech announces big changes to variable pay policy - Who will benefit? When will employees get hike? Details here
items.summary: HCL Tech will switch from a quarterly variable pay to fixed salaries for all employees and implement salary increments starting October 2025. The change aims to primarily benefit junior staff, while senior employees will still receive annual performance bonuses.

items.title: Retail inflation cools to 99-month low at 1.5% in September
items.summary: Dip in India’s retail inflation, lowest in 8 years, prompts debate on further rate cuts

items.title: BofA hikes gold’s 2026 target to $5,000; sees silver testing $65 but with this caution
items.summary: Bank of America has boosted its price targets for gold and silver. Gold is now projected to reach $5,000 per ounce by 2026. Silver's target is set at $65 per ounce. These forecasts are supported by fiscal deficits and a push for lower interest rates. Silver has already seen significant gains this year, crossing the $50 mark.

items.title: HCL Tech Q2 Results: Revenue up 5.2%, net profit rises 10.2% QoQ; Rs 12 dividend declared
items.summary: HCL Technologies, India’s third-largest IT services company, posted Q2 FY26 revenue of Rs 31,942 crore and EBIT of Rs 5,550 crore (17.4 per cent margin), beating Zee Business estimates.

items.title: Explore how non-convertible debentures provide fixed income and higher yields for safer, long-term investments
items.summary: Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) offer fixed returns, flexible tenures and higher yields than deposits, making them a preferred investment option for investors seeking predictable income and portfolio diversification.

items.title: Kashmir’s district shifts away from poppy, sees rise in rural earnings through new crops
IIMA Ventures, Jaivel to invest in 8–10 deeptech start-ups through new defence fund
items.summary: IIMA Ventures has previously backed several aerospace and defence-focused start-ups, including Sagar Defense, ePlane, Ideaforge, NabhDrishti, Nopo Nanotechnologies, and Onnes Cryogenics

items.title: HCL Tech Headcount: Amid IT layoffs, Noida-based firm adds 3,489 employees in Q2 FY26; attrition at 12.6%
items.summary: HCL Technologies announced its Q2 FY26 results today, showing a clear divergence from the broader IT industry trend of job cuts. While peers such as Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) trimmed their workforce significantly, HCL Tech continued to expand its employee base, supported by strong fresher hiring and improved retention.

items.title: Dow Jones soars 500 points, Nasdaq, S&P 500 up 1% after Trump cools rhetoric on China
items.summary: U.S. stocks rallied Monday after President Trump eased concerns about China tariffs, stating "it will all be fine." This sharp turnaround from Friday's threats offered hope for global trade, potentially allowing a rolling recovery to continue. The market's volatility echoes past swings, with strategists suggesting conditions could support a recovery into 2026.

items.title: Call for collaborative efforts to strengthen India’s urban rail network
